website_summaries.verdict: A good budget setup that runs well in most situations and offers good specs.
pros: Nice amount of hard disk space and RAM for the price
Smooth when surfing the Internet and watching videos
Can upgrade with a PCI card and memory
cons: Graphics card underperforms on some newer games

customer_reviews.title: Defective Units, would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: WOULD NOT RECOMMEND First unit I was sent only worked for a hour before shutting off, Tried to turn it on, other then the inside lights powering on, nothing happens at all, no signal and no power to the USBs. Instructions was missing too so that’s a negative. So I figured I’ll send back to amazon and get a replacement, probably an one time fluke. The other one I got worked for a few hours before it started to randomly shut off without notice, uninstall everything I added and everything, still randomly shuts off. I don’t recommend this PC at all, I was sent two defective units that don’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Maxxwell

customer_reviews.title: I guess...for the money.
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this for my son, whom plays CoD and Fortnite mainly. His previous computer was a 9 year old computer that the graphics card finally went out on so I figured, heck, why not get him something more up to date and not break the bank. Unfortunately it won't run Fortnite above the low settings at 30 fps without being completely choppy with tearing and very pixelated. I would not recommend this computer to anyone whom games honestly, this is more like a work station computer than a gaming computer.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not too happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a present. After two days it started shutting down for no reason every ten mins. Had to return it. Was not happy with it and for the price I expected more.
customer_reviews.author: Loris

customer_reviews.title: It works well. I use Minecraft and ROBLOX without any issues!!
customer_reviews.text: I use ROBLOX and Minecraft on the PC. Good graphics. Great starter gaming computer for a 11 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: CYBERPOWERPC
customer_reviews.text: This is the best computer I have seen. Setup was fast and simple (Out-of-the-box) plug and play. The LED lighting is fantastic. The ONLY thing I can say bad about this computer is that it came with "CD software and the computer does not have a CD drive" I will need to buy a portable CD/DVD drive to be able to install the included software.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this computer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my grandson for Christmas and it hasn't worked properly yet. When I called Tech support they gave me a 5 step process to try. I had to get an IT person to do this. It still didn't work properly. After dealing with this for almost 3 months i am now told it could be the hard drive. I don't usually write reviews but felt it was necessary based on the poor support and the expense i have gone through to try to get this working. It is still not working
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and either buy the warranty or avoid it entirely... I was lucky enough to be able to return it ... But it doesn't do anything other than run the internet. Couldn't stream at all & when I took it to Frys electronics they told me it needed a whole different motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica 3162

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming pc for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an artist, I work from home, and I play quite a few video games. I just needed a PC that could handle my current work load and this computer does just that. It plays my games that I have smoothly and I've had very few issues. I've currently played some Conan Exiles and Final Fantasy 14, and all seems pretty smooth so far. The PC is also super silent. Lower than the hum of a refrigerator. Before long you won't even notice it. For the price, you can't beat the product.
customer_reviews.author: roy

customer_reviews.title: Total Trash !!!  Do Not Buy !
customer_reviews.text: Total Trash ! Bottom end everything in this system. If you buy this system the only part worth keeping is the case. Very misleading system description. Don't make the same mistake I did, spend a few hundred more on a system that's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Mathis

customer_reviews.title: Great pc
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great pc for the price, it is plenty fast lacks on the graphics a little but a really good graphics card can cost more than this. But will play most games good but expect to lower down your settings. As far as speed though it’s fast. I have no trouble running any program so far the cooling system works great it stays right around 75 degrees in the case and I run it night and day
customer_reviews.author: madisyn

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great gaming PC
customer_reviews.text: This is my son’s first gaming PC and would recommend. Easy to install and to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing.
customer_reviews.text: I made the jump on being economical and it was a big mistake. Especially when it comes to pre-builds. The AMD GPU is so trash. This can't even play GTA V a game that came out 7 years ago. Do yourself a favor and save a headache. Avoid this product. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: diego flores

customer_reviews.title: Not the best choice
customer_reviews.text: wouldn’t really recommend if you wanna play fortnite with this only if u wanna run 30 fps on low sens pubs and 40-60 fps on creative like other games is fine like minecraft, roblox. wouldn’t recommend put more money into a different pc.
customer_reviews.author: Brayan

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: This was, in my opinion, a perfect budget gaming pc purchase. I was not looking for anything close to the 1000 plus dollar builds that are out there. I was just looking for something that can handle average games with no lag. This clearly surpasses that. I am loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Delgado

customer_reviews.title: CYBERPOWERPC
customer_reviews.text: I love the PC, works great for my stuff. it could use a few more upgrades. Only issue is that Graphic card will not accept 3 monitors..
customer_reviews.author: David Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: Best gaming pc I have ever used I just love it
customer_reviews.author: James ulrigg

customer_reviews.title: Great for minecraft
customer_reviews.text: i bought this computer for basic usage and minecraft maybe a lil roblox and it handles great i paid 449$ for it and i have no regrets its nice.
customer_reviews.author: Zkariyahu

customer_reviews.title: Old parts, not a gaming PC as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: For the price I guess you can use it for everyday tasks but not for gaming!!
customer_reviews.author: Anth

customer_reviews.title: You can't run more than one monitor on this machine.
customer_reviews.text: How can this possibly be? I've bought small $200 garbage PC's that can handle two monitors. This is actually ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: simon

customer_reviews.title: i can play most steam games
customer_reviews.text: Thank you! i am able to run most of my games and their is a lot of room for upgrade plus windows and a sick mouse :D
customer_reviews.author: Folajoke Adegbembo

customer_reviews.title: This is soo bad
customer_reviews.text: The fact that I don’t know how to return this is a reason that this mistake of a computer is taking up space in my room
customer_reviews.author: Owen Griffin

customer_reviews.title: So far so good easy to hook up and go
customer_reviews.text: Every easy to hook up and get things going walks you threw it I’m using it for on line classes and a little bit of gaming
customer_reviews.author: jammie radmer

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: VEry good for the price. Runs every game i’ve tried super good!! Fortnite, Leage of legends, Csgo and more.
customer_reviews.author: devin

customer_reviews.title: Gaming PC
customer_reviews.text: This product is everything they said it would and more.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Childree

customer_reviews.title: Old Outdated Tech
customer_reviews.text: This was a low end computer in 2012 when the CPU and Graphics Card were released. The CPU is not a true 6-core even though it is marketed as one. This rig will need major upgrading to play most current games.
customer_reviews.author: RABinAZ

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: FYI for those that aren’t in the know, FX chips are obsolete. While the chips and supporting motherboards may be cheap you’re better off saving up for a modern cpu, they are far more efficient and much faster.
customer_reviews.author: Cohors

customer_reviews.title: Nice Looking Tower
customer_reviews.text: This computer is out-of-date and will require a new motherboard, cpu, gpu, and psu in order to keep up with the current gaming system requirements. Spend a couple hundred more and get something that can be upgraded over time. This setup is at EOL (end of lifecycle). Like I said the tower is nice but that is it.
customer_reviews.author: SH DNA

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price but expensive to build
customer_reviews.text: Ok yes you can game with it. It’s ok for the price the graphics are ok but if you want to upgrade it it’s going to be a lot of money. I used this pc for a year when I decided I wanted better graphics and frames to stream on twitch. I bought a rtx 2060 ultra $600 ( the motherboard supports it) but the power supply blew so I bought a 800w can’t remember the price but it was around $100 but then my cpu was broken saying I was using 3 core so I bought a new cpu $187. So again you are better off building a pc but this one is ok for its price
customer_reviews.author: Maku_komori

customer_reviews.title: For those who dont know much about gaming desktops
customer_reviews.text: Listen instead of buying prebuilt gaming desktops look at the price then go to youtube an search up 600$ gaming desktop build to get the most out of you're money an build it you're self after you watch tutorials or if you dont feel comfortable building it try and find some one to build it for you who know what their doing or if you have a micro center near you go there and ask them for help do you're full research on pre built gaming desktops before you actually buy them
customer_reviews.author: Bliss

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: i really did enjoy it for my first ever pc but i have some of my own complaints. for example it lags like alot when i play fortnite on all low settings.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for your money
customer_reviews.text: Although its not the best computer for gaming its still an excellent choice especially if you don't have a lot of money, still thought, it runs games smoothly and has worked well for me, and the customer support has been excellent, as soon as anything broke i got a replacement sent right away.
customer_reviews.author: S.Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Really bad and weak Pc
customer_reviews.text: This gaming pc is extremely weak. These computer parts are extremely old around 7 years and the one I bought broke within 7 months, and the warranty is only 1 month long I would build one instead of buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Super easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my sons 12th birthday. Super easy to set up, came with a wireless usb for wifi. The keyboard and mouse is very nice, and changes colors. I felt like so far it is running great. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Terri M.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: If I could rate a zero I would not only did it come with the motherboard Not working, I couldn’t download windows 10, but Amazon still has yet to refund my money after they’ve already received item back. Worst service I ever Received.
customer_reviews.author: Bonita L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great pc
customer_reviews.text: Love this pc it was a great gift for my birthday only thing was graphics card wasn’t the best but I just upgraded mine to a GeForce 2080 rtx what is what I would recommend but other than that it looks great runs great doesn’t overheat and just a great overall performance
customer_reviews.author: Nathan F

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get it
customer_reviews.text: it Legit gets 5 FPS it can’t play any games the rgb is only one color
customer_reviews.author: Ameliaf Lynch

product_meta.title: CyberpowerPC Gamer Ultra Gaming PC, AMD FX-6300 3.5GHz, Radeon R7 240 2GB, 8GB DDR3, 1TB HDD, WiFi & Win 10 Home (GUA884)
product_meta.description: Style:Processor: AMD FX-6300Get the most out of your computing experience with the CyberpowerPC Gamer Ultra Series of computers. These desktops feature powerful AMD multi-core processors to not only handle your intense gaming sessions, but to also tackle everyday tasks such as web browsing, email, and social networking. The Gamer Ultra Series is powered by discrete graphics cards for a significant visual performance Boost over integrated graphics. Don't limit yourself to a single screen; The Gamer Ultra Series is multi-monitor compatible for the ultimate multitasking experience.
feature_bullets: System: AMD FX-6300 3.5GHz 6-Core | AMD 760G Chipset | 8GB DDR3 | 1TB HDD | Genuine Windows 10 Home 64-bit
Graphics: AMD Radeon R7 240 2GB Video Card | 1x VGA | 1x DVI | 1x HDMI
Connectivity: 6 x USB 2.0 | 1x RJ-45 Network Ethernet 10/100/1000 | 802.11AC Wi-Fi | Audio: 7.1 Channel | Keyboard and Mouse
Special Feature: Tempered Glass Side Case Panel | RGB 7 Colors Gaming mouse
Warranty: 1 Year Parts & Labor Warranty | Free Lifetime Tech Support
